authorsByline: Cliff Pinckard | cpinckard@cleveland.com, Cliff Pinckard, cpinckar
title: 1 person dead, another injured in Geauga County house fire
description: Firefighters struggled to navigate through the cluttered home to reach the trapped woman.
content:
BURTON TOWNSHIP, Ohio — A 68-year-old woman is dead and a 69-year-old man was injured in an early-morning house fire Sunday in Geauga County.

A news release from the Burton Volunteer Fire Department says the fire at the single-story home on the 14000 block of Erwin Drive was reported just before 4 a.m. The man at the home was able to escape the fire but the woman was trapped inside, officials say.

Light smoke was coming from the back of the home when firefighters arrived. Attempts to rescue the woman were hindered because a door was blocked and by “extreme clutter,” the news release says.

Once firefighters found the woman, they got her out of the home through a bedroom window.

Both the man and woman were taken to a hospital for treatment. The woman died at the hospital of her injuries. The man was listed in stable condition Sunday, according to the fire department.

Two dogs in the home were rescued and revived by firefighters. Fire departments from several nearby communities also responded to the scene.

The cause of the fire is under investigation by the State Fire Marshal’s Office. It’s estimated the house had $160,000 in damage.
summary: A 68-year-old woman is dead and a 69-year man is injured in a house fire in Geauga County, Ohio. The fire was reported at around 4 a.m. The man was able to escape the fire, but the woman remained trapped inside. Both were taken to a hospital for treatment. The cause of the fire is under investigation by the State Fire Marshal's Office.
shortSummary: A 68-year-old woman died and a 69-year old was injured in a house fire in Geauga, requiring extensive investigation by the State Fire Marshal.
argos_summary: A house fire in Burton Township, Ohio, killed a 68‑year‑old woman and injured a 69‑year‑old man. Firefighters rescued the woman through a bedroom window but she later died from her injuries, while the man was treated in stable condition. The blaze, which caused about $160,000 in damage, is under investigation by the State Fire Marshal’s Office.
